info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 12:32AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN WESTMORELAND AND NORTHEASTERN FAYETTE COUNTIES THROUGH 1245 AM EDT... At 1232 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lawson Heights to near Mount Pleasant to Scottdale. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mount Pleasant, Scottdale, Ligonier, Seven Springs, Calumet-Norvelt, Everson, Laurel Mountain, Donegal, Champion, Indian Head, Acme, and Jones Mills. This includes Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 79 and 99. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
